profile.name: Baasil Pasha
profile.title: Machine Learning & Computer Science Student
profile.bio: Machine Learning researcher with a passion for building intelligent systems from first principles. Currently exploring computer vision, LLMs, and automation tooling while pursuing dual degrees in Economics-Math and Data Science.
profile.about:
I'm a machine learning researcher and computer science student interested in the intersection of deep learning, systems engineering, and applied research. My work spans computer vision, large language models, and building automation tools that make complex workflows more accessible.

I believe in learning by building‚Äîwhether that's implementing Vision Transformers from scratch, optimizing inference pipelines, or creating reproducible research tools. I'm drawn to projects that require both theoretical understanding and practical systems thinking.

Currently seeking internships, research positions, or early-career opportunities in ML engineering, computer vision, or applied AI research where I can contribute to meaningful problems while continuing to grow as both a researcher and engineer.

focusAreas.title: Machine Learning
focusAreas.description: Building and training neural networks, understanding optimization techniques, and implementing ML algorithms from scratch

focusAreas.title: Computer Vision
focusAreas.description: Vision transformers, image classification, and exploring modern architectures for visual understanding

focusAreas.title: Large Language Models

projects.name: VisionTransformer
projects.summary: A compact PyTorch implementation of Vision Transformer (ViT) for CIFAR-10 classification with performance optimizations.
highlights: Implemented complete ViT architecture from scratch in PyTorch
Integrated Automatic Mixed Precision (AMP) and channels_last memory format for optimized training
bullets: Built patch embedding, multi-head self-attention, and transformer encoder blocks
Implemented full training pipeline with data augmentation and learning rate scheduling
Added model export functionality for deployment
Achieved competitive accuracy on CIFAR-10 benchmark
Optimized memory usage and training speed with PyTorch best practices

projects.name: llm-from-scratch
projects.summary: Building a large language model from the ground up following Sebastian Raschka's methodology, focusing on understanding transformer fundamentals.
highlights: Implemented attention mechanisms and transformer architecture from first principles
Built complete training and evaluation pipeline without relying on high-level abstractions
bullets: Coded self-attention and multi-head attention layers from scratch
Implemented positional encoding and feedforward networks
Built custom training loop with gradient accumulation
Created tokenization and data preprocessing utilities
Focused on understanding every component rather than using pre-built libraries

projects.name: lecture-transcription-scripts
projects.summary: Automated batch transcription pipeline for lecture videos using whisper.cpp, optimized for Apple Silicon.
highlights: Built end-to-end automation for processing hundreds of lecture videos
Optimized for M1 architecture achieving 2-3x speedup over CPU-only implementations
bullets: Created shell scripts for batch processing .mp4 files through whisper.cpp
Implemented parallel processing for efficient multi-file transcription
Added error handling and progress tracking for long-running jobs
Configured Metal acceleration for Apple Silicon GPUs
Generated timestamped transcripts with configurable output formats

projects.name: MachineLearning
projects.summary: Undergraduate machine learning coursework implementing classical ML algorithms and techniques in Python and MATLAB.
highlights: Implemented eigenfaces for facial recognition using PCA
Built neural networks and various classifiers from scratch
bullets: Coded principal component analysis (PCA) for dimensionality reduction
Implemented k-nearest neighbors, decision trees, and linear classifiers
Built feedforward neural networks with backpropagation
Created data preprocessing and feature engineering pipelines
Explored both Python (NumPy/Scikit-learn) and MATLAB implementations

Understanding backtesting methodologies
